==Events==
*[[1264]] &ndash; [[Battle of Lewes]]: [[Henry III of England]] is captured and forced to sign the [[Mise of Lewes]], making [[Simon de Montfort, 6th Earl of Leicester|Simon de Montfort]] the ''[[de facto]]'' ruler of [[England]].
*[[1509]] &ndash; [[Battle of Agnadello]]: In [[northern Italy]], [[France|French]] forces defeat the [[Republic of Venice|Venetians]].
*[[1607]] &ndash; [[Jamestown, Virginia]] is settled as an [[Kingdom of England|English]] [[colony]].
*[[1608]] &ndash; The [[Protestant Union]] is founded in [[Auhausen]].
*[[1610]] &ndash; [[Henry IV of France]] is assassinated, bringing [[Louis XIII]] to the throne.
*[[1643]] &ndash; Four-year-old [[Louis XIV of France|Louis XIV]] becomes King of France upon the death of his father, [[Louis XIII of France|Louis XIII]].
*[[1747]] &ndash; [[War of the Austrian Succession]]: A [[Kingdom of Great Britain|British]] fleet under [[Admiral (United Kingdom)|Admiral]] [[George Anson, 1st Baron Anson|George Anson]] defeats the French at the [[First Battle of Cape Finisterre (1747)|First Battle of Cape Finisterre]].
*[[1787]] &ndash; In [[Philadelphia, Pennsylvania]], delegates convene a [[Constitutional Convention (United States)|Constitutional Convention]] to write a new [[United States Constitution|Constitution]] for the [[United States]]; [[George Washington]] presides.
*[[1796]] &ndash; [[Edward Jenner]] administers the first [[smallpox]] [[vaccination]].
*[[1804]] &ndash; The [[Lewis and Clark Expedition]] departs from [[Camp Dubois]] and begins its historic journey by traveling up the [[Missouri River]].
*[[1811]] &ndash; [[Paraguay]]: [[Pedro Juan Caballero (politician)|Pedro Juan Caballero]], [[Fulgencio Yegros]] and [[José Gaspar Rodríguez de Francia]] start actions to depose the Spanish governor 
*[[1836]] &ndash; The [[Treaties of Velasco]] are signed in [[Velasco, Texas]].
*[[1863]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: The [[Battle of Jackson, Mississippi|Battle of Jackson]] takes place.
*[[1868]] &ndash; [[Boshin War]]: The [[Battle of Utsunomiya Castle]] ends as former [[Tokugawa shogunate]] forces withdraw northward to [[Aizu]] by way of [[Nikkō]].
*[[1870]] &ndash; The first game of [[rugby football|rugby]] in [[New Zealand]] is played in [[Nelson, New Zealand|Nelson]] between [[Nelson College]] and the Nelson Rugby Football Club.
*[[1879]] &ndash; The first group of 463 [[Indian indenture system|Indian indentured laborers]] arrives in [[Fiji]] aboard the {{ship||Leonidas|ship|6}}.
*[[1889]] &ndash; The children's [[Charitable organization|charity]], the [[National Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Children]] is launched in London.
*[[1897]] &ndash; ''[[The Stars and Stripes Forever]]'' is first performed in public near [[Willow Grove Park]], [[Philadelphia]], [[Pennsylvania]].
*[[1913]] &ndash; [[Governor of New York]] [[William Sulzer]] approves the charter for the [[Rockefeller Foundation]], which begins operations with a $100 million donation from [[John D. Rockefeller]].
*[[1925]] &ndash; [[Virginia Woolf]]'s novel ''[[Mrs Dalloway]]'' is published.
*[[1929]] &ndash; [[Wilfred Rhodes]] takes his 4000th [[first-class cricket|first-class]] [[wicket]] during a performance of 9 for 39 at [[Leyton]]; he is the only player in history to have reached that number.
*[[1931]] &ndash; [[Ådalen shootings]]: Five people are killed in [[Ådalen]], [[Sweden]], as soldiers open fire on an unarmed [[trade union]] demonstration.
*[[1935]] &ndash; The [[Philippines]] ratifies an independence agreement.
*[[1939]] &ndash; [[Lina Medina]] becomes the youngest confirmed [[mother]] in medical history at the age of five.
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Rotterdam]] is bombed by the [[Nazi Germany|German]] [[Luftwaffe]]. 
*  1940   &ndash; World War II: The [[Battle of the Netherlands]] ends with the [[Netherlands]] surrendering to Germany.
*  1940   &ndash; The [[Yermolayev Yer-2]], a long-range [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] [[medium bomber]], makes its first flight.
*[[1943]] &ndash; World War II: A Japanese [[submarine]] sinks {{Ship|AHS|Centaur}} off the coast of [[Queensland]].
*[[1948]] &ndash; [[Israel]] is declared to be an independent state and a [[provisional government]] is established. Immediately after the declaration, Israel is attacked by the neighboring Arab states, triggering the [[1948 Arab-Israeli War]].
*[[1951]] &ndash; Trains run on the [[Talyllyn Railway]] in [[Wales]] for the first time since [[heritage railway|preservation]], making it the first railway in the world to be operated by volunteers.
*[[1955]] &ndash; [[Cold War]]: Eight [[Communism|Communist]] bloc countries, including the [[Soviet Union]], sign a mutual defense [[treaty]] called the [[Warsaw Pact]].
*[[1961]] &ndash; [[American civil rights movement]]: The [[Freedom Riders]] bus is fire-bombed near [[Anniston, Alabama]], and the [[civil rights]] protesters are beaten by an [[angry mob]].
*[[1963]] &ndash; [[Kuwait]] joins the [[United Nations]].
*[[1970]] &ndash; The [[Red Army Faction]] is established in [[West Germany]].
*[[1973]] &ndash; ''[[Skylab]]'', the United States' first [[space station]], is launched.
*[[1988]] &ndash; [[Carrollton bus collision]]: A [[drunk driving|drunk driver]] traveling the wrong way on [[Interstate 71]] near [[Carrollton, Kentucky]], United States hits a converted [[school bus]] carrying a church youth group. Twenty-seven die in the crash and ensuing fire.
*[[2004]] &ndash; The [[Constitutional Court of South Korea]] overturns the impeachment of [[President of South Korea|President]] [[Roh Moo-hyun]].
*[[2012]] &ndash; [[Agni Air Flight CHT]] crashes near [[Jomsom Airport]] in [[Jomsom]], [[Nepal]], after a failed [[go-around]], killing 15 people.
*[[2013]] &ndash; [[Nigeria]]n [[President of Nigeria|President]] [[Goodluck Jonathan]] declares a [[state of emergency]] in the northeast states of [[Borno State|Borno]], [[Yobe State|Yobe]] and [[Adamawa State|Adamawa]] due to the terrorist activities of [[Boko Haram]].
